text: Christopher Czerapowicz ( ; born 15 September 1991) is a Swedish- AmericanEurobasket player profile professional basketball player for Monbus Obradoiro of the Spanish Liga ACB. He is also a member of the Sweden national team, making his senior debut in 2016. ==College career== ===College statistics=== |- | 2010–11 | Davidson Wildcats | 21 | 0 | 9.3 | .375 | .291 | .600 | 1.9 | 0.3 | 0.2 | 0.1 | 3.5 |- | 2011–12 | Davidson Wildcats | 33 | 7 | 25.1 | .414 | .342 | .694 | 4.9 | 0.7 | 0.2 | 0.4 | 10.1 |- | 2012–13 | Davidson Wildcats | 34 | 34 | 25.7 | .431 | .390 | .792 | 5.0 | 0.5 | 0.4 | 0.2 | 9.1 |- | 2013–14 | Davidson Wildcats | 33 | 33 | 25.3 | .415 | .288 | .705 | 4.3 | 0.7 | 0.5 | 0.3 | 8.8 |} == Professional career == === Södertälje Kings (2014–2016) === Czerapowicz began his career playing with the first- tiered Swedish team Södertälje Kings in the 2014-15 season, helping the team win the league both 2015 and 2016. === Miasto Szkła Krosno (2016–2017) === In June 2016, Czerapowicz joined first-tiered Polish team Miasto Szkła Krosno. === MoraBanc Andorra (2017) === In February 2017, it was announced that Czerapowicz was leaving Krosno to join BC MoraBanc Andorra playing in Spanish Liga ACB. === Tsmoki-Minsk (2017–2018) === In August 2017, it was announced that Czerapowicz would be joining belarussian Tsmoki-Minsk in the Russian first-tier league VTB United League. === Nizhny Novgorod (2018–2019) === After a great first season in the VTB United League, BC Nizhny Novgorod announced in July that they had signed a two-year deal with Czerapowicz. === Monbus Obradoiro (2019–present) === On July 19, 2019, Czerapowicz signed with Spanish club Monbus Obradoiro. == International career == Czerapowicz began his career with the national team 2007, playing in the U16 (2007) team. He has also represented Sweden in the U18 (2008, 2009), U20 (2010, 2011) and UNI (2013) teams. He was invited to play with the senior team for EuroBasket 2013 but declined due to unfinished studies at Davidson. His senor debut came at the EuroBasket 2017 qualification 2016. ==References== == External links == * RealGM.com profile * FIBA.com profile Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:BC Andorra players Category:BC Nizhny Novgorod players Category:BC Tsmoki-Minsk players Category:Davidson Wildcats men's basketball players Category:KKK MOSiR Krosno players Category:Liga ACB players Category:Obradoiro CAB players Category:Shooting guards Category:Small forwards Category:Södertälje Kings players Category:Sportspeople from Gothenburg Category:Swedish expatriate basketball people in Belarus Category:Swedish expatriate basketball people in Poland Category:Swedish expatriate basketball people in Russia Category:Swedish expatriate basketball people in Spain Category:Swedish men's basketball players Category:Swedish people of American descent
title: Chris Czerapowicz
